friend_mood: feeling afraid because my friend had been looking at pictures of car crashes. Now, she is afraid to drive anywhere. Seriously, she can hardly go anywhere a car might be.
your_mood: feeling grateful when I remember the time my family surprised me with a birthday party.
history:
friend: I have been looking at pictures of crazy car crashes.
me: Oh really? Any interesting ones?
friend: Seriously now I can't drive anywhere. I can't even leave the house for fear of car crash
me: I'm so sorry to hear that you're feeling this way after seeing those pictures. It must be really tough for you.
friend: Yeah, it's been really hard. I just can't shake off the fear.
me: I understand how overwhelming it can be. Just remember to take it one step at a time and maybe talk to someone about it.
friend: That's a good idea. Thanks for understanding.
me: Of course, anytime you need to talk, I'm here for you. Just take care of yourself, alright?

friend_mood: feeling trusting because my friend thinks having faith in someone is important in life. She has that with her husband without a doubt.
your_mood: feeling grateful when I reflect on the time spent volunteering in my community.
your_strategy: sharing own thoughts/opinion, acknowledging or admitting
history:
friend: I think that my husband and me have so much faith in each other.
me: thats awesome to hear, a lot of people cheat on each other frequently and dont care anymore
friend: I know, I cant do that. I think it's very important to be honest in your love li
me: I totally agree with you. Having faith and trust in a relationship is so important, just like the honesty you and your husband share.
friend: Thank you, I believe it's the foundation of a strong relationship.
me: Absolutely, I have also found that being honest and trustworthy in all aspects of life brings so much fulfillment.
friend: That's wonderful to hear. It's so rewarding to have that sense of trust and honesty.
me: It truly is. I'm truly happy for you and your husband for having that strong bond. 

By sharing my thoughts and acknowledging her feelings, we are able to have a meaningful conversation that validates her feelings while also expressing my own perspective.

friend_mood: feeling excited because his wife is coming back home after being out of the country for 2 months.
your_mood: feeling guilty when I remember lying to my best friend about something important.
history:
friend: My wife is coming home after being out of the country for 2 months.  I can't wait!
me: You must be really excited!
friend: I am!  We've never been apart this long, so it's been tou
me: That's great news that your wife is coming back! I can imagine how excited you must be.
friend: Yes, I can't wait to see her again and catch up on everything.
me: It must have been tough being apart for so long. I'm really happy for you that she's finally coming back.
friend: Thank you, I really appreciate that. How have you been?
me: I've been good, thanks for asking. (If you feel comfortable sharing, you can also mention your guilt and seek advice or support from your friend at this point)

friend_mood: feeling prepared because my friend used to live in California. Early one morning, they had a smallish earthquake. It made him realize he had not put together an emergency package, so he immediately did so. He believes it never hurts to be ready for the Big One!
your_mood: feeling grateful when I remember the support I received from my friends during a difficult time.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sharing or relating to own experience
history:
friend: Since that earthquake in the early hours of the morning I realized how badly off I would be if I didn't get an emergency packet together. So that's what I did - cash, water, important documents, a change of clothing.
me: wow, it must have been quite an experience
friend: It was enough to wake me, but not the cat, lol. It just made me realize that the Big One could happen any time and I would have been up the proverbial cre
me: It's great that you were able to put together an emergency package so quickly. It's important to be prepared.
friend: Yeah, it was a wake-up call for sure. It's better to be safe than sorry.
me: I remember when I went through a tough time, having supportive friends like you made all the difference. It's always comforting to know you have people who have your back.
friend: Absolutely, having a strong support system is invaluable. I'm glad I could count on you during my time of need.
me: Likewise, I'm always here for you. We should all look out for each other, especially during challenging times.
friend: Definitely, that's what true friendship is all about. Thank you for always being there for me.
me: Anytime, that's what friends are for.

friend_mood: feeling lonely because my friend feels so lonely because he/she is all by himself/herself.
your_mood: feeling melancholic when I remember the time I had to say goodbye to my childhood home.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sympathizing, expressing care or concern
history:
friend: I am so lonely because I am all by myself
me: Aw, I'm sorry, well I'm here to talk to you! 
friend: I appreciate that. It's just tough because I go daily without talking to anyone. It's nice to talk to some
me: I can imagine how tough it must be to feel lonely. I'm here for you and I'm glad we can talk.
friend: Thank you for being here for me. It means a lot.
me: I'm really sorry to hear that you're feeling this way. If you ever need to talk or if there's anything I can do, please let me know.
friend: Thank you, I appreciate your support. It's nice to have someone to talk to. 
me: Of course, anytime. We all need someone to talk to. Just remember that I care about you.

friend_mood: feeling anticipating because my friend is so eager for her son to be born, she cannot wait.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember getting lost in a foreign city during my solo trip last year.
history:
friend: I am so excited for my baby son to be born, I am so eager for it to happen!
me: Oh man, your life is about to get so much more hectic. I feel for you. When my first was born, I was just as pumped, full of naivety and positivity. I felt like I could take on anything coming my way. I was exhausted after two weeks. It's such a long ride until they're able to even remotely look after themselves.
friend: I know! Hopefully the stress levels are kept to a minimal and I have a very supporting husband who will be there every step of the way. I hope for a swift and trouble free bir
me: I can understand your excitement and eagerness for your baby son to be born. It's such a special time. Just remember to take one step at a time and enjoy the journey, even though it can be a bit overwhelming at times.

friend: Thank you, I appreciate your understanding and advice. It's reassuring to know that others have gone through similar experiences.

me: Absolutely, it's a challenging but rewarding journey. I'm sure with your supportive husband by your side, everything will go smoothly. Just take care of yourself and enjoy every moment with your little one.

friend: That means a lot, thank you for your kind words. I'll definitely keep that in mind. And I hope you find peace and comfort as you remember your solo trip experience. If you ever need to talk about it, I'm here for you.

me: Thank you, I appreciate your support. It means a lot to me. Let's continue to be there for each other through both the exciting and challenging times.

friend_mood: feeling disappointed because my friend was really down after he found out that he was not going to be able to move.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember getting lost in a foreign city during my travels.
history:
friend: I was really down after I found out that I was not going to be able to move.
me: Why? How did that happen?
friend: Becaue I am stuck at a mine site and no one will buy me out. No one wants to live at a mine site with land collapsing everywher
me: That sounds really tough. Can you tell me more about what happened?
friend: I am stuck at a mine site and no one will buy me out. No one wants to live at a mine site with land collapsing everywhere.
me: I'm so sorry to hear that. It must be really challenging for you. If there's anything I can do to help or support you, please let me know.
friend: Thanks, I appreciate your support. It's just a tough situation that I'm trying to figure out. 
me: I understand, and I'm here for you. Remember, tough times don't last forever. Let's work through this together.

friend_mood: feeling confident because the other day, my friend landed his first ollie on a skateboard in 14 years. It felt great to him.
your_mood: feeling excited when I scored the winning goal in the championship game last year.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sharing own thoughts/opinion
history:
friend: I landed an ollie on my skateboard for the first time in 14 years yesterday.
me: holy moly thats great i cant ever walk normal
friend: Yeah it took a lot of practi
me: Wow, that's amazing! I can imagine the feeling of accomplishment. It must be so rewarding after all that practice.
friend: Yeah, it felt great to finally nail it after so many tries. 
me: I totally get that feeling. I remember how I felt when I scored the winning goal in the championship game last year. It was such a rush!
friend: That's awesome! It's such a great feeling to achieve something you've been working hard on.
me: Definitely! I'm so happy for you. Keep up the good work and keep pushing yourself to achieve more goals. 

By acknowledging my friend's accomplishment and sharing my own experience, I am able to support and encourage him while also relating to his feelings of success.

friend_mood: feeling proud because my friend recently hit a new personal record at the gym!
your_mood: feeling anxious when I recall the time I got lost in a foreign city.
history:
friend: I recently hit a new personal record at the gym! I was very excited.
me: That is a great accomplishment. I admire your dedication in obtaining that goal.
friend: Thank you! I didn't feel like I would ever be able to do it, but consistency does seem to pay o
me: That's amazing! I can see how hard you've been working towards that goal. Your dedication is truly inspiring.
friend: Thank you! It wasn't easy, but it feels great to see progress.
me: Consistency really does pay off. Your hard work definitely shows. Keep it up, I'm sure you'll reach even greater milestones.
friend: I appreciate your encouragement. It means a lot coming from you.
me: Of course, anytime! Keep pushing yourself, I have no doubt you'll continue to achieve great things.

friend_mood: feeling joyful because my friend really likes going to Disneyland and is planning a trip there for next summer vacation with their family.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember getting lost in a foreign country.
history:
friend: im really exited to go to disneyland on vacation next summer
me: Omg that sounds like so much fun!!!!! Orlando? 
friend: yes im staying at the hotel for the first time i am really ha
me: That sounds so exciting! I'm happy for you that you get to go to Disneyland and stay at a hotel for the first time. 
friend: Thank you, I can't wait! 
me: I can imagine how much fun you'll have. I remember feeling anxious when I got lost in a foreign country, so I hope everything goes smoothly for you.
friend: That must have been scary. Thank you for your concern. 
me: Of course, just make sure to have a great time and stay safe!

friend_mood: feeling furious because my friend's little brother dumped a glass of water on her while she was sleeping just because they are in a prank war.
your_mood: feeling grateful when I remember the time my best friend helped me through a difficult breakup.
history:
friend: my little brother dumped a glass of water on me this morning to wake me up
me: oh god, that must have been the worst way to wake up in the morning
friend: yeah i was furious we are in some sort of a prank 
me: Oh wow, that must have been really frustrating to wake up that way, especially in the middle of a prank war.
friend: Yeah, I was so mad at him, it's getting out of hand.
me: I can imagine how that would feel. I remember when my best friend helped me through a tough breakup, it was a really rough time.
friend: Yeah, it's hard to keep cool in situations like this.
me: Definitely. Maybe you two should sit down and have a talk about setting some boundaries for this prank war.
friend: That's actually a good idea, thanks for understanding.

friend_mood: feeling disappointed because their birthday was last week. They never heard from their brother or sister to wish them a happy birthday. They guess they expected too much and they let them down.
your_mood: feeling happy when I think about the surprise birthday party my friends threw for me last year.
history:
friend: My birthday was last week and I never heard from my brother OR my sister to wish me a happy birthday.
me: oh no I am sorry to hear that! They must have been really busy and it must have slipped their mind
friend: I guess I shouldn't expect so much from them and let myself get let down like I ha
me: I'm really sorry to hear that your brother and sister didn't reach out to wish you a happy birthday. It's understandable to feel disappointed, but don't be too hard on yourself.
friend: Yeah, I guess I shouldn't expect too much.
me: I completely understand how you feel. Last year, my friends surprised me with a birthday party, and it was such a special moment that I'll always cherish.
friend: That sounds lovely. I'm glad you had such a great experience.
me: Thank you. Just remember, your worth is not defined by others' actions. You deserve to feel loved and celebrated on your birthday.
friend: You're right. Thank you for your kind words. They mean a lot to me.
me: Anytime. I'm here for you if you need to talk or if you want to do something special to make up for it.

friend_mood: feeling annoyed because their car wouldn't start today after work. They had to get a jump start!
your_mood: feeling grateful when I remember the time my best friend helped me through a difficult breakup.
history:
friend: So my car wouldn't start today after work. I kind of hate my car!
me: That's terrible to hear. Is it old?
friend: Oh yes, very old. It's a 2002 and while I've had it for 6 years now, I'm finally starting to grow tired of 
me: I'm sorry to hear about your car troubles, that must have been frustrating.
friend: It was really annoying, especially after a long day at work.
me: I can understand that. I remember when my car broke down and it was such a hassle. But it's good that you were able to get it started again.
friend: Yeah, I was lucky to have someone help me out. 
me: It's always nice to have someone there when you need them. Let me know if you need any more help with your car troubles. 
friend: Thanks, I appreciate that. And I'm glad you had someone to help you through your tough times too.

friend_mood: feeling hopeful because my friend is starting a new job tomorrow. He's feeling really nervous, but optimistic.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember getting lost in a foreign city during my solo trip last summer.
history:
friend: My new job is starting tomorrow. I'm feeling nervous, but really optimistic about it.
me: hey that's cool it's a new opportunity, what are you gonna do?
friend: It's a job they opened up for graphic design! I'm super excited to get started and learn more from th
me: That's really exciting! I know starting a new job can be nerve-wracking, but I believe you will do great in graphic design.
friend: Thank you so much for the encouragement. I really appreciate it.
me: I remember feeling nervous when I was lost in a foreign city last summer, but everything turned out fine. Remember to stay positive and take one step at a time.
friend: That's a good point, I will keep that in mind. Thank you for sharing your experience.

friend_mood: feeling grateful because my friend having a healthy baby.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I recall the time I got lost in a foreign city.
your_strategy: sympathizing, sharing or relating to own experience
history:
friend: When I was pregnant, I felt ill until it was over. The doctors were worried that something was wrong with the baby.
me: Oh no! I'm not sure how all that works, but I thought that was fairly normal for a pregnat woman
friend: Usually the sickness stops within the first few months, so the fact that I fell ill so much was worrisome. Despite it all, I had a healthy, bouncing baby boy. I never have felt more grateful in my li
me: I can only imagine how worried you must have been during that time, but I'm so glad everything turned out well and you have a healthy baby boy now.
friend: Thank you, it was definitely a tough time but it was all worth it in the end.
me: I can relate to feeling anxious during uncertain times. I remember a time when I got lost in a foreign city and it was really scary.
friend: Oh no, that sounds like a scary experience. How did you handle it?
me: It was definitely a nerve-wracking experience, but I eventually found my way back with the help of some locals. It's moments like that where you realize how resilient you can be. 
friend: That's true, we never know how strong we are until we face challenges. I'm glad you made it back safely. 
me: Thank you. And I'm really happy for you and your healthy baby boy. 

By using the strategies of sympathizing and sharing personal experience, I was able to connect with my friend and support her during her moment of gratitude, while also sharing a similar feeling of anxiety from my own experience.

friend_mood: feeling nostalgic because the other day, my friend installed Everquest, a video game he played as a teen. He played it for several weeks.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember getting lost in a foreign city during my solo trip last summer.
your_strategy: sharing own thoughts/opinion, sharing or relating to own experience
history:
friend: Have you ever played and old video game called Everquest?
me: I haven't heard of it
friend: It came out in 1999. I used to play it when i was a teen. I installed it the other day and had a good time playi
me: That's interesting, I can see why playing Everquest would bring back some good memories for you. Speaking of old memories, I still get anxious when I think about getting lost in a foreign city during my solo trip last summer.
friend: Oh, I'm sorry to hear that. That must have been a stressful experience for you.
me: It was definitely tough, but I learned a lot from that experience. It's funny how certain memories can still affect us years later.
friend: Absolutely, memories have a way of sticking with us. I'm here if you ever need to talk about it.
me: Thanks, I appreciate that. And I'm glad you're enjoying playing Everquest again, it must be nice to relive those memories.

friend_mood: feeling sad because my friend's son is in so much pain.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember getting lost in a foreign country during a trip.
your_strategy: sympathizing, sharing or relating to own experience
history:
friend: my son is teething really bad and he is so inconsolable that breaks my heart. i can't wait till these molars cut thru
me: I remember my kids going through that. Do you have teething rings for him?
friend: I do but he doesn't like them. he can barely eat his mouth hurts so 
me: I'm so sorry to hear that your son is going through a tough time with teething. It must be really hard for you to see him in pain.
friend: It is heartbreaking. I just wish I could take his pain away.
me: I understand how difficult it is to see your child in pain. When my kids were teething, it was also tough to see them struggle. Have you tried any other remedies besides teething rings?
friend: I've tried a few things, but nothing seems to be working. It's just so tough to see him like this.
me: I can imagine how tough it must be for you. Just remember that you're doing your best as a parent and you're there for him every step of the way. If you need any support or if there's anything I can do to help, please let me know.

friend_mood: feeling joyful because my friend went to the beach the other day. It filled him with such a sense of calm and joy.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I recall the time I got lost in a foreign city.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sharing or relating to own experience
history:
friend: I went to the beach other day
me: That is really cool . Did you have a good time?
friend: I sure did! the ocean and the breeze gives me such a sense of joy and c
me: That sounds amazing, I'm glad you had such a wonderful time at the beach.
friend: Thanks! It was really refreshing.
me: I can imagine, being near the ocean always brings a sense of peace. Speaking of being in new places, I once got lost in a foreign city and it was quite a stressful experience.
friend: Oh wow, that must have been tough. How did you manage to find your way back?
me: It was definitely a challenge, but I eventually found my way with the help of some kind locals. It was a learning experience for sure.
friend: That's really interesting. I'm glad you made it back safely. Let's hope for more smooth travels in the future.
me: Definitely, and I'm happy you had such a great experience at the beach. Here's to more calming and joyful moments for both of us.

friend_mood: feeling jealous because my friend got with him for money.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember getting lost while hiking in the wilderness last summer.
history:
friend: I had to sit in the front while she was in the back with him
me: Was he with you or just someone you wanted to be with?
friend: I wanted her. But he had the money. And that's what she wan
me: I'm sorry to hear that, it must be really hard to see someone you care about choosing money over genuine connection.

friend: Yeah, it's really frustrating. I just wish things were different.

me: I understand how you feel. Money can sometimes cloud people's judgment and make them prioritize the wrong things. It's tough.

friend: You're right. I just wish she could see that too.

me: Definitely. Relationships should be based on genuine feelings, not material things. I hope you find peace with the situation. 

friend: Thank you for understanding. It means a lot to me. 

me: Of course, I'm here for you. Let's focus on what truly matters and move forward positively. 

friend: Agreed. Thank you for being a good friend during this difficult time. 

me: Anytime. I'm here whenever you need to talk.

friend_mood: feeling guilty because my friend feels guilty for eating their housemate's last chocolate bar.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember my first public speaking event.
history:
friend: Ate my flatmates last chocolate bar earlier.
me: Well, I hope they said you could have it.
friend: Nope, i do feel a bit guilty about it but they should have hid it bett
me: I can understand why you feel guilty, but don't be too hard on yourself. It happens to all of us at some point.
friend: Yeah, I know, but I still feel bad about it.
me: It's okay to feel that way. We all make mistakes. Speaking of feeling bad, I remember my first public speaking event was a nerve-wracking experience.
friend: Really? How did you handle it?
me: I was so anxious, but I practiced a lot and tried to focus on the positives. It helped me get through it.
friend: Thanks for sharing that. I'll try to make it right with my housemate.
me: I'm sure they'll understand. Just be honest and apologize.

friend_mood: feeling excited because my friend is very worked up about completing their doctoral thesis and defending it this year.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I recall the time I got lost in a foreign city.
history:
friend: I have a ton of work to complete to earn my degree this year.
me: Well good luck with that!
friend: Thank you, I have been compiling  data for 5 years, my brain is totally absorbed by 
me: It's amazing that you have been working so hard on your doctoral thesis for 5 years. I admire your dedication.
friend: Thank you, it's been a long journey. My brain is so focused on compiling all the data.
me: You deserve a break from all that intense work. Maybe you should take a day off to relax and recharge.
friend: That's a good idea. I really need to unwind a bit. Thank you for suggesting that.
me: Of course, taking care of yourself is important too. You've got this!

friend_mood: feeling impressed because my friend was blown away when her six-year-old nephew solved the Navier-Stokes existence and smoothness problem. He will be getting the million dollar prize for it, which she hopes he doesn't blow on cocaine and beef jerky.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember the time I got lost in a foreign city.
your_strategy: sharing or relating to own experience, expressing care or concern
history:
friend: Honestly? I have a pretty special nephew. He just solved the Navier-Stokes existence and smoothness Millenium Prize problem.
me: Holy moses, he must be as smart as me. I solved that thing in five minutes last week. Child's play.
friend: Child's play is right, the kid is only 6 years old. And you couldn't have, because the Clay Institute says the million dollar prize is still at large, which I'm sure he will be blowing immediately on Tropical Sprite and cocai
me: Wow, that's truly impressive! It must be amazing to see such talent in someone so young. 
friend: I know, right? I just hope he uses the prize money wisely.
me: Absolutely, it would be a shame if he wasted it. On a different note, I remember when I got lost in a foreign city once, it was so stressful.
friend: Oh no, that sounds terrible. I hope you were able to find your way back safely.
me: Yes, luckily I did. It was a valuable lesson in staying calm in difficult situations.
friend: Definitely, staying calm is key. Thank you for sharing that. Let's hope my nephew makes wise choices with his prize money.

friend_mood: feeling anxious because whenever my friend has to give a presentation, he gets so nervous. Mentally, he doesn't really care, but his legs shake, his heart pounds, and he speaks too quickly. Being the center of attention makes him feel that way.
your_mood: feeling grateful when I recall the time I received a surprise promotion at work.
history:
friend: I hate giving big presentations and being the center of attention.
me: Me too. Its nerve wrecking
friend: I know! Like, mentally, I don't care, but my body just responds by making my legs shake, my heart pound, and speaking too quick
me: I can understand how nerve-wracking it must be for you to give presentations. It's great that you can acknowledge that mentally you don't care, but your body reacts that way.
friend: Yeah, it's frustrating. 
me: When I received a surprise promotion at work, I felt a mix of emotions too. It's important to remember the positive outcomes that can come from these challenging situations.
friend: That's a good point. Thank you for sharing your experience.
me: Of course! Just remember to take deep breaths and focus on the valuable knowledge you're sharing in your presentations. You've got this!

friend_mood: feeling apprehensive because they are going to Six Flags this weekend and their kids want them to ride one of the roller coasters. They haven't ridden one in a very long time and they're really hesitant because they don't think they will like it at all. They really just want to watch.
your_mood: feeling regretful when I remember breaking my friend's favorite vase at a party.
history:
friend: We are going to Six Flags this weekend and my kids want me to ride the roller coaster with them.
me: Sounds like found!   Are you scared of roller coasters?  I love them!
friend: I'm really hesitant to get on. It's been a long time since I've ridden one and I don't think I'm going to like it at 
me: I completely understand why you feel hesitant about riding the roller coaster. It's totally okay to just watch and enjoy the day with your kids.
friend: Thanks, I appreciate your understanding. Do you have any other suggestions on what else we could do at Six Flags?
me: Maybe you two should go try out the water rides or explore some of the other attractions at the park. That way, you can still have a great time without having to ride the roller coaster.
friend: That actually sounds like a great idea! Thanks for the suggestion.

friend_mood: feeling afraid because my friend was all alone in the house. He had all the lights off and was alone in his bed. It was storming outside, and he couldn't fall asleep.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember getting lost in a foreign city during my solo trip.
history:
friend: I just had to spend the night all alone in the house. The power was out and It was storming outside.
me: That sounds like it could be quite a scary experience.
friend: I started a small fire in the trash can to get some light. It almost started a fi
me: I'm so sorry to hear that you had to spend the night alone in the dark during the storm. That sounds really scary.
friend: Yeah, it was quite terrifying. I even started a small fire in the trash can for some light, but it almost caused another problem.
me: I can imagine how frightening that must have been. I remember feeling anxious when I got lost in a foreign city during my solo trip. It was a similar feeling of vulnerability.
friend: Wow, that sounds scary too. I hope you were able to find your way back safely.
me: Yeah, thankfully I managed to find my way back. Let's hope that both of us never have to experience such fear again.

Friend: Thanks for sharing your experience. It actually makes me feel a little bit better knowing I'm not the only one who has been through a scary situation.
me: Of course, we all go through moments of fear and vulnerability. Just remember that I'm here for you if you ever need someone to talk to.

friend_mood: feeling angry because the other morning at 4 am, my friend was woken by his neighbor's smoke alarm going off. At first he didn't know what was going on, then he realized and didn't appreciate it!
your_mood: feeling proud when I won first place in the school spelling bee.
history:
friend: I wish my neighbors were more considerate. They woke me up at 4am recently.
me: Wow did youcall someone about that?
friend: No point. Their smoke alarm went off and management don't care anyw
me: I'm really sorry to hear that your neighbors woke you up at 4 am. That must have been really frustrating.
friend: Yeah, it was really annoying. And management doesn't seem to care at all.
me: I can understand how that would be upsetting. On a brighter note, I actually won first place in the school spelling bee!
friend: Wow, that's amazing! Congratulations on your achievement. It's nice to hear some good news amidst all this frustration.
me: Thank you! I hope things get better with your neighbors soon. And if you need any support, I'm here for you.

friend_mood: feeling excited because my friend remembers when he was younger, he saved up all summer and took odd jobs so he could buy a Dreamcast. It was probably the most he had ever anticipated anything.
your_mood: feeling embarrassed when I tripped and fell in front of everyone at a party.
history:
friend: I babysat and worked odd jobs all summer when i was younger to save up and buy a sega dreamcast.
me: Oh god I miss my dreamcast, I bet you were so happy when you got it.
friend: Yep, i've never looked forward to something so much in my life. I still have the dreamcast as wel
me: That must have been such a thrilling moment when you finally bought your Dreamcast. 
friend: Yes, it was! I still have it, and it brings back so many good memories.
me: I can imagine how excited you must have felt. By the way, I know how embarrassing it can be to trip in front of everyone at a party. I hope you're not feeling too down about it. 
friend: Oh, thanks for understanding. It was definitely a moment I won't forget. 
me: No problem, we all have those moments. Just remember to brush it off and move forward.

friend_mood: feeling angry because my friend was in a drive-thru line and someone cut in front of some other people. He confronted the guy about it and the guy basically told him to take a hike. He was furious and blew up at him. Finally, the guy left the line but flipped him off when he did.
your_mood: feeling relieved when I finally finished my thesis project.
your_strategy: expressing care or concern, sharing own thoughts/opinion
history:
friend: I almost got in a fight in a drive-thru lineup.
me: What happened? Did someone bump on your car?
friend: No, the person cut in front of some other people.  I confronted him about it and we got into a shouting mat
me: Oh wow, that sounds like a really frustrating situation. I hope everything is okay now.
friend: Yeah, it was really annoying. I just couldn't believe the audacity of that guy.
me: I can understand why you would be upset. In situations like that, it's important to stay calm and try to resolve things peacefully if possible.

By expressing care and sharing my thoughts on staying calm in such situations, I can show my friend that I care about his well-being and offer some advice on handling similar situations in the future.

friend_mood: feeling annoyed because there are problems with their system at work and no one will take responsibility or fix it, they said.
your_mood: feeling lonely when I remember spending the holidays by myself last year.
history:
friend: Our computer system at work is goofing up a lot, but the development team just keeps saying there's nothing wrong.
me: Ugh, I bet that is really frustrating. Is it making it difficult to do your job?
friend: Sometimes. It doesn't stop me from doing things, just slows me down and takes longer than it should to do the things I need to 
me: I'm sorry to hear about the issues at work. It must be really frustrating to deal with that.
friend: Yeah, it's been a mess. No one seems to care to fix it.
me: I can understand how that feels. Feeling like no one is taking responsibility can be really frustrating. It reminds me of a time when I felt the same way at my previous job.
friend: It's just so annoying. I'm just trying to do my job efficiently.
me: I completely understand. You deserve to have a functional system to work with. If you need to vent or talk about it, I'm here for you. And by the way, I also felt lonely during the holidays last year, so I can relate to the feeling.

friend_mood: feeling afraid because one time, someone came to my friend's door with a gun. He wanted money, but my friend didn't have any, so the person stole some items from the house.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember getting lost in a foreign city during my vacation.
history:
friend: Someone came to my door with a gun the other day.
me: What did you do in response?
friend: I called the police after he robbed 
me: So sorry to hear that happened to you. It must have been a terrifying experience.
friend: It was really scary. I didn't know what to do.
me: I can only imagine how frightening that must have been. When I got lost in a foreign city, I felt completely helpless too.
friend: It's a horrible feeling. I hope it never happens to you again.
me: Thank you, I hope so too. If you need anything or just want to talk about it, I'm here for you.
friend: I appreciate that, thank you. It helps to talk about it.

friend_mood: feeling jealous because my friend has been trying really hard to get a promotion at their company but they just hired someone to fill that spot from outside of the company.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember the time I got lost in a foreign country.
history:
friend: I've been trying really hard to get a promotion at my company but they just hired someone to fill that spot from outside of the company.
me: Ahh, that's too bad, did you mention it to your boss?
friend: My boss is pretty temperamental and doesn't like people questioning his decisions, probably a bad ide
me: I'm so sorry to hear that. It must be really disappointing for you.
friend: Yeah, it is. I'm just not sure what to do now.
me: Maybe you could try talking to HR about other growth opportunities within the company? It might be worth exploring different options.
friend: That's a good idea, I didn't think about that. Thank you for suggesting.
me: Of course, I'm here to support you. You deserve the best opportunities.
friend: Thank you, it means a lot to me.

friend_mood: feeling confident because my friend feels so good about knowing she is going to win the race on Sunday. The race is for her favorite charity. When she wins the race, she gets to give her winnings to her charity of choice.
your_mood: feeling proud when I recall the moment I graduated from college.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sharing or relating to own experience
history:
friend: I feel so good about knowing I am going to win the race on Sunday. The race is for my favorite charity. When I win the race I get to give my winnings to my charity of choice.
me: That's wonderful! Do you have a charity in mind yet?
friend: Yes, it is my local animal shelter. They will be there to cheer me o
me: That's wonderful! I can imagine how exciting it must be to participate in the race for such a great cause. When I graduated from college, I felt a similar sense of pride and accomplishment.
friend: Thank you! It's truly a rewarding experience, and I can't wait to support my local animal shelter with the winnings.
me: It's amazing to see your dedication and passion for helping others. I'm sure you will do great in the race and make a significant impact on the charity.
friend: Your support means a lot to me. Thank you for understanding and sharing your own experience. It's uplifting to have friends like you by my side.
me: Of course, I'm always here to support you and cheer you on. Good luck on the race, I know you will achieve great things for the charity!

friend_mood: feeling anticipating because my friend and her husband are going on their very first cruise in December. She is so excited. She has wanted to go on a cruise for a few years now. It's awesome that she will finally be going on one soon.
your_mood: feeling frustrated when I didn't get the promotion I worked so hard for.
history:
friend: My husband and I are going on our very first cruise in December. i can't wait!!!
me: I love vacations I hope you and him have a good time.
friend: I hope so too. I have wanted to go on a cruise for so long. I'm happy were are able to go this ye
me: That sounds so exciting! I'm really happy for you that you finally get to go on a cruise. You deserve this amazing vacation.
friend: Thank you! I really can't wait. I feel like it's a dream coming true.
me: I can imagine how thrilled you must be. I wish you both have an incredible time on the cruise. 
friend: I appreciate that. I'm sure things will turn around for you soon as well. Don't give up hope.
me: Thanks, I really needed to hear that. Your support means a lot to me. Enjoy your cruise and make lots of wonderful memories!

friend_mood: feeling disappointed because my friend recently had a wonderful experience with a woman he really likes. The night ended poorly and he came across very disappointed with the ending.
your_mood: feeling grateful when I remember the support I received from my friends during a difficult time.
history:
friend: I recently went on a trip with a woman I adore. The trip ended poorly, though, and things have not been the same since.
me: I hate to hear that, what happened that made it end poorly?
friend: We did not capitalize well on the short amount of time that we had togeth
me: I'm really sorry to hear that the trip ended poorly. It must have been tough for you.
friend: Yeah, it was really disappointing. We just couldn't make the most of our time together.
me: I can imagine how that feels. It's tough when something doesn't turn out the way you hoped.
friend: Exactly. I was really looking forward to it.
me: I understand. It's important to cherish the good moments, though, even if it didn't end perfectly.

This dialogue will show my friend that I empathize with his disappointment and also offer a perspective on finding gratitude in challenging situations.

friend_mood: feeling jealous because once, my friend had plans to meet up with an old flame. He got to the spot and spotted her from across the room. She gave him a big hug, and then introduced him to her new boyfriend.
your_mood: feeling proud when I graduated from college.
history:
friend: I met up with an old flame recently, didn't go how I expected
me: Oh ya? What happened?? I'm intrigued
friend: Well, right after she gave me a big hug, she introduced me to her new boyfrie
me: Oh, I'm so sorry to hear that. It must have been tough. 
friend: Yeah, it was really unexpected. 
me: I can imagine how that felt. In the past, I had a similar experience where things didn't go as planned. 
friend: Really? How did you handle it?
me: Well, I tried to focus on the positive things in my life, like my graduation, to help me get through it. 
friend: That's a good point. Thanks for listening and sharing your experience.
me: Of course, anytime. Just remember, you deserve to be happy regardless of the situation.

friend_mood: feeling annoyed because my friend just did a bunch of work and messed it up in the end. Now he's not sure if he'll get paid.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remembered getting lost in a foreign city during my solo trip.
history:
friend: I just got an assigment.  I was doing well on it but rushed through the very end.  Now I'm not sure I'll be paid.
me: Why would you not get paid?
friend: I can no longer prove I did the assignment.  Computer work is for the birds sometim
me: I'm sorry to hear that you're going through this. It's definitely frustrating.
friend: Thanks, it really is. I just wish I had taken more time to double-check everything.
me: Don't be too hard on yourself. Mistakes happen to all of us. I believe you can figure it out and get the payment you deserve.
friend: I really hope so. Your support means a lot.
me: Of course, anytime you need to talk or vent, I'm here for you. And hopefully, everything will work out in the end.

friend_mood: feeling trusting because their daughter's teenage boyfriend was in charge of taking care of their animals and home while they went on vacation. Luckily, he was a good young man, so they didn't worry he would try to steal anything. They felt it was safe and in good hands.
your_mood: feeling grateful when I reflect on the time I was able to travel to Japan with my family.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sharing own thoughts/opinion
history:
friend: We took a vacation recently and had to leave my daughter's teenage boyfriend a key to our house so he could take care of the pets. He's a good young man, so we didn't feel uncomfortable anything would come up missing.
me: Lucky! I would not trust anyone in my house!
friend: We didn't have much choice, as we had an outdoor dog and indoor cat, so if we didn't, we'd come back to not having pets. But, I wouldn't just let anybody, that's for su
me: That's really fortunate that you had someone you could trust to take care of your pets and home while you were on vacation. I can imagine how relieved you must have felt.

friend: Yes, exactly. It's always a bit nerve-wracking to leave your house and pets in someone else's hands, but he did a great job.

me: I remember when my family and I went on vacation to Japan, we had to arrange for someone to look after our house and pets too. It's such a relief when you find someone trustworthy to take care of everything.

friend: Absolutely, it's definitely a weight off your shoulders when you know everything is in good hands. Thank you for sharing your experience.

friend_mood: feeling grateful because to see in the mornings that beautiful and leafy tree in the mornings ... it makes my friend feel that God exists.
your_mood: feeling relieved when I finished my final exams in college.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sharing own thoughts/opinion
history:
friend: This morning and I saw a tree, I never detailed it, but this time I saw it beautiful ... I realized God exists
me: I see, you must have felt hopeful
friend: I gave thanks in spite of the difficult
me: That's truly a beautiful experience. I'm glad you found such peace and connection in nature.
friend: It was truly a special moment for me. I felt so grateful.
me: I understand what you mean. For me, finishing my exams also brought a sense of relief and accomplishment.
friend: I'm happy for you too. It's great to celebrate milestones together.
me: Definitely, we all deserve to find moments of peace and joy in our lives. Let's continue to appreciate the beauty around us.

friend_mood: feeling lonely because when my friend's sister passed away several years ago, he had such a hard time with the loss. He felt very much separate from others in dealing with his grief.
your_mood: feeling grateful when I think of the time my friends surprised me with a birthday party.
history:
friend: My sister passed away several years ago. I really had a hard time with the grief and couldn't really relate to anyone that tried to help me with it.
me: i'm sorry to hear that. i know exactly what you are going through. My brother tragically passed away 2.5 years ago. He was only 32
friend: Yes, I'm sure you can relate as well. Ironically, that was the same age that my sister passed away. She took her own life, which my mother and I found her, and it was very hard for us all. But, I couldn't burden my parents with my pain, I fe
me: I can't imagine how tough that must have been for you and your family. I'm truly sorry for your loss.
friend: Thank you for understanding. It's been a difficult journey.
me: I can relate to some extent. My brother passed away tragically as well, so I know the pain of losing a loved one.
friend: I'm so sorry to hear that. Loss is never easy.
me: It's been a rough road, but talking about it helps. If you ever need to talk, I'm here for you.
friend: That means a lot. Thank you for sharing your experience with me.
me: Of course, we all need support during tough times.

friend_mood: feeling joyful because holding each of his/her children for the first time was amazing for my friend. He/She can't think of anything else that produces the type of feelings that it produces.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I remember giving a presentation in front of a large audience.
your_strategy: sharing or relating to own experience, sympathizing
history:
friend: Holding each of my children for the first time was amazing.
me: I remember that feeling with my daughter, it is indescribable.
friend: Yes!! I can't think of any thing else that produces feelings like th
me: I remember that feeling with my daughter, it is truly indescribable.
friend: Yes!! I can't think of any thing else that produces feelings like that.
me: It's such a special and unforgettable moment, I'm really happy for you.
friend: Thank you! It's a feeling like no other. I hope you can experience something similar in the future.
me: I hope so too. Thanks for sharing that wonderful moment with me.

friend_mood: feeling lonely because today was the first day of school for my friend's kids. It's been so quiet there.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I recall getting lost in a foreign city during my solo trip last summer.
history:
friend: This is the first time ever that both of my kids have been in school.
me: Interesting, are you feeling OK having less bonding time?
friend: Yeah, it's just too quiet l
me: I can imagine how quiet and lonely the house must feel with both kids at school. 
friend: Yeah, it's a big adjustment for me.
me: I remember feeling anxious and alone when I got lost during my solo trip last summer. It can be tough.
friend: It's comforting to know I'm not the only one feeling this way.
me: Absolutely, we all have those moments. Just remember, you're doing a great job and you're not alone in feeling this way.
friend: Thank you for understanding. It means a lot.
me: Of course, anytime you need to talk, I'm here for you.

friend_mood: feeling sad because my friend misses their puppy. She passed away recently and it was really sudden and sad.
your_mood: feeling grateful when I remember the time my best friend helped me through a difficult breakup.
history:
friend: I lost a puppy recently and I'm still broken up about it.
me: I am so sorry I have been there so many times
friend: it's never going to be ok, but it will be a little less painful in ti
me: I am so sorry to hear about your puppy. Losing a pet is truly heart-wrenching.
friend: Thank you, it's been really tough for me.
me: I understand how you feel. I went through a similar situation when I lost my cat a few years ago. It was devastating.
friend: It's so hard to deal with the loss. I miss my puppy so much.
me: I completely understand. Take your time to grieve and remember the good times you had with your puppy. And if you need anything, I'm here for you.
friend: Thank you, I appreciate your support.

By using these strategies, I can show empathy towards my friend's situation and also share my own experience to let her know that she is not alone in her feelings.

friend_mood: feeling impressed because my friend never believed their grandpa was a rockstar until he jumped onto the stage and bit the head off of a bat. Then he belted the words to 'Crazy Train' and jumped out into the audience! Wow!
your_mood: feeling grateful when I remember the time I was able to travel to Europe with my best friends.
your_strategy: acknowledging or admitting, sharing own thoughts/opinion
history:
friend: My grandpa always said he was a rockstar back in his day, but I never believed him. 
me: Why don't you believe him? He made have been quite the big name back in his day.
friend: I don't know if he was famous, but the other day, he got on stage, bit the head off of a bat, then belted the words to Crazy Train. It was unbelievab
me: Wow, that's really amazing! It must have been quite a show.
friend: I couldn't believe it myself! It was like he was a whole different person up there.
me: It's so cool to discover new things about our family members, right?
friend: Definitely! I never knew he had it in him. 
me: It's always interesting to uncover these hidden talents in our loved ones. It makes you appreciate them even more.
friend: Exactly! I have a newfound respect for him now.
me: That's awesome. It must have been a memorable experience.

friend_mood: feeling anxious because my friend had a meeting with a new doctor this week. He hates meeting new doctors.
your_mood: feeling grateful when I remember the time my family surprised me with a birthday party.
history:
friend: I had to meet my new physical therapist this week.
me: Did everything work out ok? How did you like them?
friend: They seem ok. I just hate having to meet new docto
me: I'm sorry to hear that you had to meet a new physical therapist. I understand that meeting new doctors can be stressful for you.
friend: Yeah, it's always nerve-wracking for me.
me: I hope everything went well and that you feel comfortable with the new therapist. If you need any support, I'm here for you.
friend: Thanks, I appreciate that. It means a lot to have your support.

friend_mood: feeling caring because even though someone wronged my friend, they still care about their well-being.
your_mood: feeling happy when I remember the time I won first place in a baking competition.
history:
friend: I was horribly wronged by someone I thought I could trust. The feeling was devastating, and I've always struggled with forgiveness.
me: Oh my, what happened? I'm so sorry, no one should treat anyone they care about poorly.
friend: They were dishonest and physically cruel. We have gone our separate ways, but I truly hope they can learn to treat others bett
me: I'm so sorry to hear that your trust was broken like that. It must have been really tough for you.
friend: It was, but I'm trying to move past it and focus on the positive.
me: I had a similar experience with someone who let me down, and it took me a while to heal from it. But I believe that time and self-care helped me through it. 
friend: Thank you for sharing that. It's comforting to know that I'm not alone in this. 
me: You're definitely not alone. And I'm here for you if you ever need someone to talk to or just to listen.

friend_mood: feeling caring because my friend saw a loose dog today, she wanted to take it home so badly. It worried her that it would get hit. She couldn't catch it.
your_mood: feeling grateful when I remember the time my friend helped me through a difficult situation.
history:
friend: I was on a run today, and saw a loose dog but couldn't catch it before it ran off!
me: That's so interesting because I saw someone post the same thing on a neighborhood app just today.  Is that you? ha ha.
friend: Maybe if you live in Central Texas...haha! But I was so worried about that small dog getting h
me: I can totally understand why you were worried about the dog. It's heartbreaking to see animals in danger.
friend: Yes, it really was. I wish I could have done more to help the little guy.
me: Your compassion for animals is one of the reasons why I admire you so much. Remember the time when you helped me through that tough situation last year? It meant the world to me.
friend: Aw, thank you for saying that. It makes me happy to know I could help you when you needed it. Let's hope that little dog finds its way back home safely. 
me: Definitely. Your kindness will always be remembered, just like how you helped me. Thank you for being such a caring friend.

friend_mood: feeling sad because my friend recently said goodbye to a good friend for a while. She loves her!
your_mood: feeling grateful when I reflect on the support I received from my friends during a difficult time.
history:
friend: I recently bid farewell to a good friend. I miss her
me: I am sorry for your loss. I hope you can find comfort during this difficult time.
friend: Thank you, that means a lot. I will see her ag
me: I'm so sorry to hear that you had to say goodbye to your good friend. It must be really tough for you.
friend: Thank you for your understanding. It's really hard for me right now.
me: I can imagine how difficult it is. Please know that I am here for you if you need anything.
friend: I appreciate that. I know we will see each other again, but it's still hard.
me: I understand. Just take your time to process everything and remember that I'm here for you.

This conversation shows support and empathy towards my friend's feelings, acknowledging her sadness and offering support during this difficult time.

friend_mood: feeling excited because my friend cannot wait for their trip next summer. They have been planning it for over 2 years and it is going to be great.
your_mood: feeling guilty when I cheated on my final exam in college.
history:
friend: i am really happy for next year i have a trip planned to go to india
me: That sounds like fun! I've always wanted to visit India.
friend: yeah i have been planning this trip for over 2 ye
me: That sounds like an amazing trip! India is such a beautiful country to visit.
friend: I know, I've been looking forward to it for so long.
me: I can imagine how excited you must be after planning it for over 2 years. It's going to be an unforgettable experience.
friend: Thank you! I really can't wait to explore all the different cultures and sights.
me: I'm so happy for you. Enjoy every moment of it. And hey, if you need any tips or recommendations, feel free to ask.

friend_mood: feeling joyful because one time my friend took part in an essay contest. A few months later she found out that her essay was chosen and that she won a trip to Washington, D.C.
your_mood: feeling grateful when I remember the support I received from my friends during a difficult time.
your_strategy: questioning for details, sharing own thoughts/opinion
history:
friend: I won a trip to Washington D.C. a few years ago
me: and how was it? did you enjoy it?
friend: I had a blast. I met people from all over the country, visited many historical sites, and learned a lot about how government wor
me: That sounds like an amazing experience! What was your favorite part about the trip to Washington D.C.? 
friend: I really enjoyed visiting the White House and learning about the history behind it. It was truly fascinating. 
me: I can imagine how exciting that must have been. Your trip sounds like a dream come true. I'm so happy for you! 
friend: Thank you! It was definitely a trip I'll never forget. 
me: It's wonderful to hear that you had such a great time. Your experience reminds me of the support I received from my friends during a difficult time. It really means a lot to have such amazing people in my life. 
friend: It's so important to have a strong support system. I'm glad you have great friends by your side. 
me: Yes, I feel truly blessed to have them. Thank you for sharing your experience with me.

friend_mood: feeling apprehensive because my friend felt so nervous going into his latest job interview.
your_mood: feeling anxious when I recall the time I got lost in a foreign city while traveling alone.
history:
friend: I felt sooooo nervous going to my last job interview! Nerves must occur in proportion to how badly you *want* something!
me: I know what you mean. Did you get the job?
friend: I did! The company does something that I actually like -- a panel interview vs a series of one-on-ones. Have you ever had an interview like th
me: I'm glad you got the job! Panel interviews can be intimidating, but it seems like it worked out well for you. I actually had a similar experience when I got lost in a foreign city while traveling alone. It was so nerve-wracking!
